laboratory_examinations.findings: Segmental inflammation of the ileum, inflammatory thickening of the rectal and anal walls, narrowing and obstruction of the intestinal lumen, secondary colon dilation and fluid accumulation, widespread inflammation and fistula formation in the lower segment of the rectum and perianal space, sacral anterior space, bilateral ischiorectal fossa, and gluteus maximus muscle space.

Black-speckled changes throughout the entire colonic mucosa, mild inflammation of the intestinal mucosa with aggregation of tissue cells that phagocytose pigments in the lamina propria, changes consistent with colonic melanosis. No crypt deformation or non-caseating granuloma observed in the biopsy specimens.

Extensive inflammation and fistula formation in the lower rectal segment and the perianal space, sacral anterior space, bilateral ischiorectal fossa, and gluteus maximus space, formation of perianal abscess.
Pathological results indicated perianal mucinous adenocarcinoma.
